intro: Vaccinium morobense, commonly known as the Morobe huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the island of New Guinea and is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and often used in local cuisine. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a slightly acidic taste. Vaccinium morobense plays an important ecological role by providing food for various wildlife species in its native habitat.
